<< convertCharsToStrings string type count >>

convertStringsToChars

Convert string arrays to character arrays.

Syntax

C = convertStringsToChars(S)
[B1, B2, ..., BN] = convertStringsToChars(A1, A2, ..., AN)

Input argument

S

if S is a string array, output C will be converted to an cell of strings or an character vector (if S is scalar).

A1, A2, ..., AN

variables to convert to char array if it is a string array.

Output argument

C

a char array or unaltered variable

B1, B2, ..., BN

variables converted to char array if it is a string array.

Description

convertStringsToChars converts string arrays to character arrays.

Example

A = convertStringsToChars("Nelson")
A = convertStringsToChars(["Nelson", string(NaN)])

See also

convertCharsToStringss, cellstr, string, char.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
